definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Look, the pavilion is High in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那亭子高高地立在空中呢。

sentences.english: Nearby, an old woman sells chocolate and cigarettes from a tiny kiosk.
sentences.chinese: 在附近的亭子里有个老婆婆在卖巧克力和香烟。

sentences.english: That pavilion is called Huxin Pavilion.
At the carnival they had all kinds of booths4.
sentences.chinese: 在嘉年华会上，孩子们有各种各样的小亭子。

sentences.english: Then we went into the imperial garden, the garden there is a pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 接着我们进了御花园，御花园里有一座亭子。

sentences.english: I can see us sitting in the pavilion down stairs the teaching building.
sentences.chinese: 我似乎可以看见我和他坐在教学楼下的小亭子里。

sentences.english: There are several scattered pavilions and teahouses throughout the park.
sentences.chinese: 有几个亭子散落其间，茶室遍布公园。

sentences.english: The pavilion has an antiquated appearance.
Suddenly she saw a little pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 突然，远远的，她看到一个小亭子。

sentences.english: And you can also find pavilions, rare flowers and ancient pines and cypresses.
sentences.chinese: 那里还有亭子，珍稀花草和古松可供观赏。

sentences.english: The pavilion on the hill looks down on the river.
Just behind the copse stands a delicately transparent pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 仅次于科普斯矗立着微妙的透明亭子。

sentences.english: Look, the pavilion is high in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 噍，那亭子高高地立在空中呢。

sentences.english: Atlas of ancient architecture pavilion construction.

definition: winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
Xiao Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
